page.title: 01E.Wantage,Ardington&Lockinge
page.content: This area covers the Eastern part of Wantage,a small market town in the Vale of the White Horse,Oxfordshire, lying at the foot of the Berkshire Downs.The population of the whole town is about 7,000. Also included are the villages of Ardington and East Lockinge,and the hamlets of W.Lockinge,Ginge and Betterton.Most of the land in this area was owned by one family (the Loyds) The estate has now been made over to a number of trusts,so that death duties will not destroy it.There is a large stud that can accommodate 40 mares and a pig farm with about 2,000 animals. There is a timber yard,where trees are sawn into planks when sold.There is also a craft centre and a number of small industries.
